Package fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth

Services for authentication and authorization, and accessing user directories.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IAuthnService
    An authentication service, capable of providing access control tickets based on information available in HTTP requests or from serialized tokens.
    IAuthzService
    An authorization service, providing information about permissions, determining what a user can see and do within the application.
    IBasicAuthn
    Holds a login-password pair.
    IDirectoryService
    An OpenAGE user directory.
    IPasswordAuthnService
    An authentication service, capable of providing access control tickets using either valid user credentials, from information available in HTTP requests, or from serialized tokens.
    IPermission
    Defines a permission that may be required to allow a user to access a secured object.
    ISecure
    Marker interface for objects with which permissions can be associated.
    ITicket
    Represents a local authentication ticket obtained from an authentication service.
    IUser
    Represents an application user.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    AuthnException
    Thrown when an operation requiring an authenticated user is attempted without an authenticated user.
    AuthzException
    Thrown when an operation requiring a user with specific privileges is attempted without an authenticated user with the required privileges.
    TicketExpiryException
    Thrown when an attempt is made to use an expired authentication ticket.
    TicketTokenException
    Thrown when an attempt is made to use an invalid authentication ticket token.

Package fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth Description

Services for authentication and authorization, and accessing user directories.

OpenAGE servers provide directory services, authentication services, and authorization services. Any other connectors are required to provide authorization services. Additional dissociated user directories and authentication services can be made available.

Since:
1.0
